title: Help identifying typeface
content:
Hi,

I'm looking for a typeface similar to the Holland and Holland wordmark. Any thoughts?? How about that sans face on the same page?

[http://www.hollandandholland.com/clothing/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20120927043357/http:/www.hollandandholland.com/clothing/index.htm "http://www.hollandandholland.com/clothing/index.htm")

Many thanks - JB01
author: JB01

comments.content:
[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/engravers-dt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120927043357/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/engravers-dt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/engravers-dt/")

[http://houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20120927043357/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfonts "http://houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfonts")

For the sans, look at Trade Gothic for example.

Actually, if you zoom in, the secondary font is really [Copperplate](http://web.archive.org/web/20120927043357/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=9&displayfontid=LH.120832.0.0&fontRendererText=Holland+%26+Holland).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120927043357im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NetNewsWireScreenSnapz001_4594.png)
The _Holland & Holland_ is actually Engravers Bold Face No. 9, from Linotype, originally from Bramhart Bros & Spindler Founders
